thread.title: ‘We have to do more’: Laurent Koscielny admits Arsenal flops have let under-fire Arsene Wenger down
thread.title_full: ‘We have to do more’: Laurent Koscielny admits Arsenal flops have let under-fire Arsene Wenger down

author: gsweet
title: ‘We have to do more’: Laurent Koscielny admits Arsenal flops have let under-fire Arsene Wenger down

organizations.name: lincoln city next up for arsenal

text:
STOP ARS-ING AROUND ‘We have to do more’: Laurent Koscielny admits Arsenal flops have let under-fire Arsene Wenger down 
Gunners defender backs fellow-Frenchman by insisting: 'We're in a complicated situation but it's not only his responsibility' By Geoff Sweet 24th March 2017, 11:36 am Updated: 24th March 2017, 11:39 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LAURENT KOSCIELNY has told his Arsenal team-mates they “have to do more” to protect under-fire boss Arsene Wenger. 
The struggling Gunners have dropped to sixth in the Premier League and a run of six defeats in nine games has also seen them booted out of the Champions League. Getty Images Arsene Wenger has the backing of Arsenal defender Laurent Koscielny 
Wenger has drawn criticism from all quarters, attracting protest marches and unrest inside the Emirates during matches. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal and Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The Frenchman has a new unsigned two-year deal lying on the table. He says he has made his decision on whether to stay or go, but as yet remains tight-lipped. Reuters 4 Koscielny says the Arsenal players must up their game to back their boss 
Now defender Koscielny insists the players must step up to the plate to ease the strain on his fellow-countryman. Most popular WARBURY V GILLS Warriors in action as Nick flies off to Florida - can they fire their way to victory? PREVIEW What is the latest England vs Lithuania teams news, what TV channel is it on and what time is kick-off? TV TIMES What TV channel is England vs Lithuania on, what time is kick-off and what is the latest team news? HART STOPPER Joe Hart to captain England vs Lithuania... but fears he could get Three Lions chop like Wayne Rooney Dier situation Eric Dier warns England fans they must behave against Lithuania after shameful actions in Germany sealing the deal Jose Mourinho pictured in Croatia as he bids to get £35million Ivan Perisic deal over the line brita 'n twisted Germany U21s 1 England U21s 0: Young Lions suffer same fate as Gareth Southgate's seniors but there's nothing unlucky about this one NORRIS MINOR Swindon's team is youngest in top 4 divisions and Luke Norris says lack of experience is costly Said Koscielny: “He’s someone who’s been very important in my career. “It’s him who gave me my chance at Arsenal, who fashioned me as a player and as a man. “We’re in a complicated situation but it’s not only his responsibility. It’s us, on the pitch, who have to do more.” Getty Images Koscielny beats Robert Lewandowski to the ball in the Champions League showdown with Bayern Munich AP:Associated Press 4 Koscielny in action in the 6-0 Emirates FA Cup win over Lincoln City Next up for Arsenal is a home Premier League date with Manchester City as they bid for a return to the top four and a coveted Champions League spot. Then comes another match at the Emirates against West Ham followed by away dates at Crystal Palace and Middlesbrough . Koscielny himself is happy with life at Arsenal. Watch Laurent Koscielny's amazing overhead kick for Arsenal against Southampton He told L'Equipe: " "I feel good, I know the club and the people who work there perfectly. "I appreciate my life in London, and so do my family. At the moment, I've got no reason to want to leave. "I've got a long contract, and I'm happy where I am.'"
